Test Description:
1) Create non secure Auth-Server 
2) Create remote group
3) Try login using remote user it should fail
4) Enable auth server
5) Login using remote user should work 
6) Login as admin, Delete group, auth-server

1) Create non secure Auth-Server 
2) Create remote group
3) Try login using remote user which is already configured in remote group, it should fail
4) Enable auth server
5) Login using remote user should work 
6) Login as admin, Delete group, auth-server

1) Create secure Auth-Server 
2) Create remote group
3) Try login using remote user which is already configured in remote group, it should fail
4) Enable auth server
5) Login using remote user should work 
6) Login as admin, Delete group, auth-server
Create group and user with non existing ldap, login should fail

Create group and user with existing ldap, login should pass
Disable ldap 
Logout 
Login again should fail

1) Create remote group groupX with role network-edit
2) Create remote group groupY with role container-edit/nsY
3) Login as userX, which is already configured in remote group groupX, create static endpoint epY in namespace nsY
4) Login as userY, which is already configured in remote group groupY, create pod uisng static endpoint epY
5) Pod should go into running state
6) Validate Pod should be using epY
7) Delete Pod
8) Delete epY
9) Delete  groups

1) Create local group groupA with role user-edit
2) Create remote user userA under groupA
3) Login as userA
4) Create remote groupB with volume-edit,volumeclaim-edit
5) Create local groupC with volume-view
6) Create remote user userC under groupC
6) Login as userB, which is already configured in remote group groupB
7) Create some volumes [static/dynamic(static pvc, dynamic pvc)]
8) Login as userC
9) userC should able to list all volumes which is created by userB
10) Login as userB delete volumes
11) Login as userA
12) Delete userC
13) Delete groupB,C
14) Login as admin, Delete userA, GroupA

1) Create local group groupA with role user-edit
2) Create remote user userA under groupA
3) Login as userA
4) Create another auth-serverX
5) Create remote group groupB with any role under auth-serverX
6) Login as userB, which is already configured in remote group groupB
7) Perform operatoin according to role
8) Login as userA
9) Delete userB, groupB, auth-serverX

Scenario / Category: Multiple Remote Group with single Remote user
Test Description:
1) Create remote group A,B,C
2) Login a single remote user under group A,B,C
3) Login should be successful and user should get all permission of group A,B and C
Expected Behaviour:
Tested with 2 groups
as ldap is configured with 2 grps only

Scenario / Category: Multiple Remote user with single Remote Group
Test Description:
1) Create a remote group X
2) Login remote users A,B,C,D,E,F given the group name as  X
3) All the users should have same previllages
Create 64 groups with different domain, subdomain
Expected Behaviour:
Tested with 9 groups only
Becase we have ldap with 9 groups under 2 AD's

Test Description:
Create auth-server with domain
Create remote group
Login as user with domain under the gruop - should work
Login as user without domain under the gruop - should work
Expected Behaviour: user able to login with invalid domain name

Test Description:
Create auth-server with domain
Create remote group
Create local user without domain(aduser3) with with remote auth
Create local user with domain(aduser4@example.com) with with remote auth
Login as user without domain - should work
Login as user with domain - should work

Scenario / Category: Domain with more than one auth-server
Test Description:
Create auth-server with domain abc.dom
Create auth-server with domain xyz.dom
Create remote group under abc.com
Create same remote group under xyz.com
Login as user with domain under the gruop - should work
Login as user without domain under the gruop - should fail

Create auth-server with domain abc.dom
Create auth-server with domain xyz.dom
Create remote group under abc.com
Create local user without domain(aduser3) with with remote auth
Create local user with domain(aduser4@example.com) with with remote auth
Login as user with domain - should work
Login as user without domain - should should fail

Create non exist remote group groupA with role node-view 
Login as userA, it should fail as remote group does not exist

1) Create remote group with invalid dimain
2) Create local user with remote auth 
3) Login as user
4) It should not able to access cluster details because domain is invalid
New behaviour, It will asccess as permission it will work as remote user
Expected Behaviour: User able to access cluster and does the operation

Test Description:
1) Create remote group groupA with role user-edit
3) Login as userA, which is already configured in remote group groupA
4) Create another auth-serverX
5) Create remote group groupB with any role under auth-serverX

6) Login as userB,which is already configured in remote group groupB
7) Login as userA
8) Delete auth-serverX
9) Try login as userB it should fail
10) Delete  groupB

1) Create remote group groupA with role user-edit
2) Login as userA,which is already configured in remote group groupA
3) Create another auth-serverX
4) Create remote group groupB with any role under auth-serverX
5) Login as  user usserB which is under remote group
6) Login as userA
7) Delete auth-serverX
8) Try login as userB it should fail
9) Delete groupB

1) Create remote group groupA mapped with remote group having special charaters in group name (except allowed charaters)
2) Try to login with user under remote group
3) User should be able to login, but should not allow to perform any action.

1) Create remote group GroupA mapped with remote group having special charaters in group name (except allowed charaters)
2) Create remote group GroupB mapped with remote group with valid name 
3) Try to login with user under remote group GroupA and GroupB
4) User should be able to login, but should have access get role specified for GroupB only.
